title: Beatrice of Burgundy, Lady of Bourbon
text:
Beatrice of Burgundy (1257 – October 1, 1310) was a ruling <a href="Sire%20de%20Bourbon">Lady of Bourbon</a> in 1288-1310 and, through her mother, heiress of all <a href="Bourbonnais">Bourbon</a> estates. 
She was the daughter of <a href="John%20of%20Burgundy%20%281231%E2%80%931268%29">John of Burgundy</a> (son of <a href="Hugh%20IV%2C%20Duke%20of%20Burgundy">Hugh IV, Duke of Burgundy</a>) and <a href="Agnes%20of%20Dampierre">Agnes of Dampierre</a>, Lady of Bourbon. In 1272 Beatrice married <a href="Robert%2C%20Count%20of%20Clermont">Robert, Count of Clermont</a> and their eldest son <a href="Louis%20I%2C%20Duke%20of%20Bourbon">Louis I, "le Boiteux"</a> became the first <a href="Duke%20of%20Bourbon">Duke of Bourbon</a>.
